bibl.title: The Megalai Ehoiai: A Survey of the Fragments.
bibl.note: [Introduction.] - The Megalai Ehoiai and Hellenistic scholarship. - Diverging traditions attributed to the Catalogue and the Megalai Ehoiai. - A survey of the fragments: Heracles and his descendants; - Heracles and Telamon; - The Argonautica fragments; - Laconian and/or Boeotian concerns?; - The Argolis; - Elis; - Conclusions, and further problems: Cyrene; - Coronis and Arsinoe; - Two lists in Philodemus and the ME. - Pp. 213-216: Appendix: The placing of the Atalanta-Ehoie in the Catalogue.

bibl.title: The Hesiodic Catalogue of Women. Constructions and Reconstructions

bibl.seg: D'ALESSIO Giovan Battista, The Megalai Ehoiai: A Survey of the Fragments.
Richard HUNTER (Ed.), The Hesiodic Catalogue of Women. Constructions and Reconstructions (Cambridge, 2005) pp. 176-216.

[Introduction.] - The Megalai Ehoiai and Hellenistic scholarship. - Diverging traditions attributed to the Catalogue and the Megalai Ehoiai. - A survey of the fragments: Heracles and his descendants; - Heracles and Telamon; - The Argonautica fragments; - Laconian and/or Boeotian concerns?; - The Argolis; - Elis; - Conclusions, and further problems: Cyrene; - Coronis and Arsinoe; - Two lists in Philodemus and the ME. - Pp. 213-216: Appendix: The placing of the Atalanta-Ehoie in the Catalogue.
